revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-04 16:22:06.000000000', 'message': 'Update default scheduler filters

Make the default set of scheduler filters conditional on the release
being deployed; For Pike or later the CoreFilter, RamFilter and
DiskFilter are superfluous to requirements as this filters are in
effect completed by the Placement API.

Add DiskFilter to list of filters for older OpenStack releases.

Change-Id: Iddb4f1f068b982dcd9a70b11b89df1be9f8aaf20
Closes-Bug: 1731302
Closes-Bug: 1732164
'}]
commit_message:
Update default scheduler filters

Make the default set of scheduler filters conditional on the release
being deployed; For Pike or later the CoreFilter, RamFilter and
DiskFilter are superfluous to requirements as this filters are in
effect completed by the Placement API.

Add DiskFilter to list of filters for older OpenStack releases.

Change-Id: Iddb4f1f068b982dcd9a70b11b89df1be9f8aaf20
Closes-Bug: 1731302
Closes-Bug: 1732164

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-02-18 13:42:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-02-18 17:33:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Why do we need to react on pod events instead of endpoints change? Won't endpoint related to the service keep all the pod addresses that belong to the service?"}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-02-18 22:50:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Why do we need to react on pod events instead of endpoints change?
 > Won't endpoint related to the service keep all the pod addresses
 > that belong to the service?

The endpoint handler reacts to pods that are selected by the service, not to the pods that are selected in the 'ingress' or 'egress' fields of the Network Policy.
For example, if we have these resources [1] created, the endpoint handler reacts for events of pods with label {run: demo}. 
So, in order to react for scale up/down of deployments with labels {app: demo2}, we need to handle it on pod events.  

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/742946/"}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-02-18 23:25:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-02-19 15:40:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-02-20 08:37:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Code looks good to me! I would try to give it a try myself before +2'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-02-20 16:41:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Okay, I get the issue now, but now I believe that this should go to the PodLabelHandler, isn't it?"}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-02-21 16:57:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

by testing it I found out the next error/race
2019-02-21 16:46:24.173 1 ERROR kuryr_kubernetes.handlers.logging Traceback (most recent call last):
2019-02-21 16:46:24.173 1 ERROR kuryr_kubernetes.handlers.logging   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/kuryr_kubernetes/handlers/logging.py", line 37, in __call__

2019-02-21 16:46:24.173 1 ERROR kuryr_kubernetes.handlers.logging     self._update_services(services, project_id)
2019-02-21 16:46:24.173 1 ERROR kuryr_kubernetes.handlers.logging   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/kuryr_kubernetes/controller/handlers/vif.py", line 217, in _update_services
2019-02-21 16:46:24.173 1 ERROR kuryr_kubernetes.handlers.logging     self._drv_lbaas.update_lbaas_sg(service, sgs)
2019-02-21 16:46:24.173 1 ERROR kuryr_kubernetes.handlers.logging   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/lbaasv2.py", line 925, in update_lbaas_sg
2019-02-21 16:46:24.173 1 ERROR kuryr_kubernetes.handlers.logging     sg_rule_name, sgs)
2019-02-21 16:46:24.173 1 ERROR kuryr_kubernetes.handlers.logging   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/lbaasv2.py", line 152, in _apply_members_security_groups
2019-02-21 16:46:24.173 1 ERROR kuryr_kubernetes.handlers.logging     lb_sg = self._find_listeners_sg(loadbalancer, lb_name=lb_name)
2019-02-21 16:46:24.173 1 ERROR kuryr_kubernetes.handlers.logging   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/lbaasv2.py", line 747, in _find_listeners_sg
2019-02-21 16:46:24.173 1 ERROR kuryr_kubernetes.handlers.logging     return sgs['security_groups'][0]['id']
2019-02-21 16:46:24.173 1 ERROR kuryr_kubernetes.handlers.logging IndexError: list index out of range


This happens when a pod is created at the same time as a service is created (with the new code) if the sg_mode==create is used. The problem comes from trying to update the lbaas_sgs when the lbaasV2 driver has not yet created the SG group for it.

I'm -1 now as this is only hit due to calling update_services from the pod creation. The apply_members_security_groups assumes the svc is already up, so, probably we need to consider that if there is no lb security group yet, we can skip this action as it will be later applied when adding the members'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-02-22 09:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-02-22 11:39:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-02-22 12:20:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-02-22 12:20:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-02-22 16:05:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-02-25 08:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-02-25 09:12:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> Okay, I get the issue now, but now I believe that this should go to
 > the PodLabelHandler, isn't it?

@dulek, right now the PodLabelHandler is meant to update port sgs on pod labels update. I believe it's possible to add the service update on pod creation on the PodLabelHandler. However, if the 'on_delete' is also added on the PodLabelHandler, I don't see any way to guarantee which of the handlers(PodLabelHandler, VIFHandler) is processed first and this probably will result in the problem where the pod was deleted before the affected service is retrieved."}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-02-26 17:41:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2019-02-27 07:43:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

(3 comments)

Few minor nits if you choose to re-spin'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-03-04 12:04:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-03-04 13:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-03-04 13:52:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Adding +W as the patch already hot the needed +2s, and only a couple of minor issues were fixed'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-03-04 15:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-03-04 18:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-03-05 07:23:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-03-05 08:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Workflow+1

It was simply a rebase, re-adding +W'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-15 13:54:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix service sg rules update on deployment scale

When deployments are scaled up or down SG rules must be also updated
on the LBaaS/Service side, by removing or adding new ones. Right now,
the LBaaS/Service do not react on deployment scales.

This commit fixes the issue by ensuring that the service SG is updated
on pod events.

Change-Id: I1c54d17a5fcff5387ffae2b132f5036ee9bf07ca
Closes-Bug: 1816015

Change-Id: I1c54d17a5fcff5387ffae2b132f5036ee9bf07ca
Closes-Bug: 1816015
'}, {'created': '2019-02-22 16:05:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix LBaaS sg rules update on deployment scale

When a service is created with a Network Policy applied and
deployments are scaled up or down, the LBaaS SG rules should be
updated accordindly. Right now, the LBaaS/Service do not react on
deployment scales.
This commit fixes the issue by ensuring that the LBaaS SG is updated
on pod events.
Also, if Pods, Network Policies and SVCs are created together it might
happen that the LBaaS SG remains with default SG rules, even though
the policy is being enforced. This commit also fixes this issue by
setting the LBaaS Spec annotation, which is used to update the LBaaS
SG, with the SGs retrieved from the service.

Change-Id: I1c54d17a5fcff5387ffae2b132f5036ee9bf07ca
Closes-Bug: 1816015
'}, {'created': '2019-02-25 08:34:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix LBaaS sg rules update on deployment scale

When a service is created with a Network Policy applied and
deployments are scaled up or down, the LBaaS SG rules should be
updated accordindly. Right now, the LBaaS/Service do not react on
deployment scales.
This commit fixes the issue by ensuring that the LBaaS SG is updated
on pod events.

Also, when Pods, Network Policies and SVCs are created together it might
happen that the LBaaS SG remains with default SG rules, even though
the policy is being enforced. This commit ensures the right SG rules
are applied on a LBaaS regardless the order of k8s resources creation.
This happens by setting the LBaaS Spec annotation whenever a request
to update the SG rules has been made and retrieving the Spec again
whenever a LBaaS member is created.

Change-Id: I1c54d17a5fcff5387ffae2b132f5036ee9bf07ca
Closes-Bug: 1816015
'}, {'created': '2019-03-04 13:19:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix LBaaS sg rules update on deployment scale

When a service is created with a Network Policy applied and
deployments are scaled up or down, the LBaaS SG rules should be
updated accordindly. Right now, the LBaaS/Service do not react on
deployment scales.
This commit fixes the issue by ensuring that the LBaaS SG is updated
on pod events.

Also, when Pods, Network Policies and SVCs are created together it might
happen that the LBaaS SG remains with default SG rules, even though
the policy is being enforced. This commit ensures the right SG rules
are applied on a LBaaS regardless the order of k8s resources creation.
This happens by setting the LBaaS Spec annotation whenever a request
to update the SG rules has been made and retrieving the Spec again
whenever a LBaaS member is created.

Change-Id: I1c54d17a5fcff5387ffae2b132f5036ee9bf07ca
Closes-Bug: 1816015
'}, {'created': '2019-03-04 15:57:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix LBaaS sg rules update on deployment scale

When a service is created with a Network Policy applied and
deployments are scaled up or down, the LBaaS SG rules should be
updated accordindly. Right now, the LBaaS/Service do not react on
deployment scales.
This commit fixes the issue by ensuring that the LBaaS SG is updated
on pod events.

Also, when Pods, Network Policies and SVCs are created together it might
happen that the LBaaS SG remains with default SG rules, even though
the policy is being enforced. This commit ensures the right SG rules
are applied on a LBaaS regardless the order of k8s resources creation.
This happens by setting the LBaaS Spec annotation whenever a request
to update the SG rules has been made and retrieving the Spec again
whenever a LBaaS member is created.

Change-Id: I1c54d17a5fcff5387ffae2b132f5036ee9bf07ca
Closes-Bug: 1816015
'}]
commit_message:
Fix LBaaS sg rules update on deployment scale

When a service is created with a Network Policy applied and
deployments are scaled up or down, the LBaaS SG rules should be
updated accordindly. Right now, the LBaaS/Service do not react on
deployment scales.
This commit fixes the issue by ensuring that the LBaaS SG is updated
on pod events.

Also, when Pods, Network Policies and SVCs are created together it might
happen that the LBaaS SG remains with default SG rules, even though
the policy is being enforced. This commit ensures the right SG rules
are applied on a LBaaS regardless the order of k8s resources creation.
This happens by setting the LBaaS Spec annotation whenever a request
to update the SG rules has been made and retrieving the Spec again
whenever a LBaaS member is created.

Change-Id: I1c54d17a5fcff5387ffae2b132f5036ee9bf07ca
Closes-Bug: 1816015

commit_message:
Run all jobs by default using python3

This patch implements the community wide goal to run all jobs by
default using python3.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I4e62491ac9a9996cfd910e7d69897b92072bb1eb

commit_message:
bugfix - added None check

Execute Mistral step sends a message to the notifier and returns no
event. We need to make sure not to add None to the list of events.

Change-Id: I1ac7bea1096d4448fce222d8d4488f921a110f33

commit_message:
Drop py35 jobs

Python 3.5 was the target runtime for the Rocky release. The current
target py3 runtime for Stein is Python 3.6, so there is no reason to
keep testing against the older version.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: I0db6c9cbf2af9ed9c701755a26f721aeac97d4cd

commit_message:
oslo.messaging: Update to 9.5.0 and Remove zeromq dependency

oslo.messaging deprecated the zeromq driver in rocky[1] and dropped it
in master[2], so drop it here.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/575778
[2] https://review.openstack.org/596882

Change-Id: I3ffd984b214d93585570c5c1e60f0c7a831f863d

(cherry picked from commit 1ee18775a99492f445f1fb29e2d4639cbdff613d)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR edge router: avoid accidental centralized floating IP remove

Need to pass centralized floating IPs as preserve_ips to
_external_gateway_added during DVR router update.
Otherwise IP addresses will be deleted from gw device in certain case.
The case is when a router with active centralized floating IPs is
being scheduled to a new dvr_snat L3 agent (rescheduled from a down one).
Please see corresponding traces in the bug description.

Change-Id: Iaeb9fbed73144df6fcd9092c665ed19986e85f4d
Closes-bug: #1817306
(cherry picked from commit 1ee18775a99492f445f1fb29e2d4639cbdff613d)

commit_message:
Improve existing flavor and image metadata validation

This improves the existing validation of flavor extra-specs and image
properties in hardware.py in preparation for calling the validation from
more places in a follow-on patch.

get_cpu_topology_constraints() becomes public as we'll need to call it
from the API code in the next patch in the series.

If the CPU topology is not valid, raise an InvalidRequest exception with
a useful error message instead of a ValueError message without any
context.

Add checks to ensure that the CPU and CPU thread policies are valid,
and if not then raise newly-added exceptions with useful error messages.

Tweak various docstrings to more accurately reflect what exceptions
they might raise.

Change-Id: I20854134c80b8f4598f375eae137fd2920114891
blueprint: flavor-extra-spec-image-property-validation
Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>

commit_message:
Disable SELinux separation for ironic_pxe_http

Currently, kolla re-apply selinux labels to the files, using
shutil.copystat() function.
It raises an error when SELinux prevents the relabelling, raising on
the host an AVC for the "relabelto" function.

Authorizing "relabelto" isn't a good idea, and a modification in kolla
code will take long.

Change-Id: I581b8df4c5b1f3631b3a23ffc0393ddda00c0fac

commit_message:
DVR edge router: avoid accidental centralized floating IP remove

Need to pass centralized floating IPs as preserve_ips to
_external_gateway_added during DVR router update.
Otherwise IP addresses will be deleted from gw device in certain case.
The case is when a router with active centralized floating IPs is
being scheduled to a new dvr_snat L3 agent (rescheduled from a down one).
Please see corresponding traces in the bug description.

Change-Id: Iaeb9fbed73144df6fcd9092c665ed19986e85f4d
Closes-bug: #1817306

Pacemaker backup task

This patch add task for backing up pacemaker configuration and makes
existing mysql backup task a bit more configurable.

Change-Id: I67b1991daf617093ec59efea5062157d59106bd4

commit_message:
mistral: Do not use basename for source

The sdist tarball needs to be downloaded somehow. Not using
fetch_source() and also not using a full url as Source does not work
in the SUSE CI.

Also remove grpcio from the tooz requirements.txt. It is not needed.
Otherwise, the mistral doc build fails with:

DistributionNotFound: The 'grpcio<1.16.0,>=1.0.0' distribution was \
  not found and is required by tooz

Change-Id: I518552130ecbc0a48cd81b830c6559c92369041b

I'm +1 on this. Eliminating HV that have had build failures makes sense in clouds with very large compute estates but not so much for smaller ones."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2019-03-04 16:56:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-04 09:29:10.000000000', 'message': "Disable BuildFailureWeigher

Disable the BuildFailureWeigher used when weighting hosts during
instance scheduling. A single build failure will result in a
-1000000 weighting which effectively excludes the hypervisor
from the scheduling decision.

A bad image can result in build failures resulting in a heavy
load on hypervisors which have not had a build failure with
those that have effectively being ignored; the build failure
count will be reset on a successful build but due to the high
weighting this won't happen until all resources on known good
hypervisors have been completely consumed.

Change-Id: I4d4367ef20e2a20aee1e26d4a0ec69cad2ac69d6
Closes-Bug: 1818239
"}]
commit_message:
Disable BuildFailureWeigher

Disable the BuildFailureWeigher used when weighting hosts during
instance scheduling. A single build failure will result in a
-1000000 weighting which effectively excludes the hypervisor
from the scheduling decision.

A bad image can result in build failures resulting in a heavy
load on hypervisors which have not had a build failure with
those that have effectively being ignored; the build failure
count will be reset on a successful build but due to the high
weighting this won't happen until all resources on known good
hypervisors have been completely consumed.

Change-Id: I4d4367ef20e2a20aee1e26d4a0ec69cad2ac69d6
Closes-Bug: 1818239

[{'created': '2019-02-21 03:52:48.000000000', 'message': "Fix tox for releasenotes

Currently tox -e releasenotes fails with ImportError: No module
named 'masakaridashboard' at[1].

This patch fixes this issue.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/masakari-dashboard/blame/master/releasenotes/source/conf.py#L66

Change-Id: I2ef95fa2c938e2a8115c0602b53c5af6329a1bac
"}, {'created': '2019-03-05 07:23:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix tox for releasenotes

tox -e releasenotes fails with error:
ImportError: No module named 'masakaridashboard'.

Since release notes are version independent, no need to set version
and release so removed importing version from masakaridashboard.

Change-Id: I2ef95fa2c938e2a8115c0602b53c5af6329a1bac
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tox for releasenotes

tox -e releasenotes fails with error:
ImportError: No module named 'masakaridashboard'.

Since release notes are version independent, no need to set version
and release so removed importing version from masakaridashboard.

Change-Id: I2ef95fa2c938e2a8115c0602b53c5af6329a1bac

Hello Sahid:

The benefit is to avoid executing everytime this function. If you know the first time this interface supports mtu, there is no need to chech it again (that means saving time).'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2017-07-19 11:51:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

hi sahid
caching this function was originally suggested by jay when i introduced support for the mtu lookup. i did not do it at the time
because i did not have time to figure out how to correctly use oslo.cache to do so before the code freeze.

if you are using ovs-vsctl to query the ovs db it causes the entire contents of the ovs db to be loaded into ram to service the request.

you also have to spend the overhead of creating a new bash shell each time a port is created to execute the ovs-vsctl command. 

we could support cacheing in memory without oslo.cache but
since os-vif is only intended to be used by nova,neutron and possibly kuryr, all of which currently depend on oslo.cache i don't see the issue of use also depending on it here since it will always be installed if nova or neutron are installed on the system.

i dont think there is merit in proving this improves performance.
rodoflo provided that proof as part of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/427145/ in the past but it had no effect in getting that code accepted."}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-07-19 12:59:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi,

The cache is going to be valid for a day only and so OVS is going to load its database into the RAM at some points in that day anyway. When it's loaded I would say the benefice will be mitigate.

But you made good point saying that olso.cache is going to be installed anyway and what about to earn the time of loading a shell and querying OVS even if have some doubts of the benefice.

Don't we have to provide a note to inform operators that if they are updating OVS so they have to restart Nova? (is this something we really want?)"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2017-07-19 15:03:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

well its a tradoff between loading the entire ovsdb into ram on for every vhost-user interface that is plugged vs once per cache interval.

on the restarting nova compute agent when ovs is upgraded that is an interesting question. with ovs-dpdk upgrading ovs is a dataplane outage. on ovs versions that did not support setting mtu for vhost user they also did not support server mode so you would have to restart any running vms on the node to fix network connectivity.

if they did not restart nova we would not configure mtus for instances on that node for untill the old value expires in the cache. then all new instances would be updated and old instances would be updated next time plug is called on them e.g. on a vm hard reboot.

for instance that were running before the ovs upgrade nothing would change with the cacheing except that instances rebooted before the cache refersh would still have the old value where as before they would have got the old value imeditly. 

prior to the introduction of the mtu field jombo frames were not supported so the default mtu of 1500 would have been used so i dont think this will casue an issue as vms would of had to have an mtu of 1500 or less to work before the ovs upgrade. 

i can see that this would be a concern if you are doing a rolling upgrade of just ovs but im not sure you would do that with instance on the current node  and while you don't have to update nova at the same time as updating ovs if you have evacuated the host to do maintenance you will likely do both at the same time."}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-07-20 10:31:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Ok Sean thanks I'm not going to block it."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-07-21 10:49:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-07-21 10:50:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I don't understand why I'm having these requirements issue: oslo.cache upper requirements in requirements project is 1.25.0"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-21 12:03:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

Honestly I'm still questioning myself of having all of this code in our tree... seems that "optimizing" osvif at this state of the development is premature.

Do we really need to optimize something here - do we have requests from users/operators saying that our lib is making the performance of the hosts worst? We are still adding a lot of changes and far for a stabilization of the lib.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2017-09-11 13:09:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

untill we have native python support for ovs which rodlfo is also working on i think this is good to have.

ovs-vsctl is expencive and we are calling it every time we plug a vhost-user port to check if setting the mtu is supported.

i honestly dont think this is a log of code to introduce.
we can continue to not cache this and it wont slow down port
pluging significatly but its unneeded work that we do not have to 
keep preforming on every port plug.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2017-09-22 09:04:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-22 10:30:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Verified-1

the two main usecases are for checking if the vwitch support setting mtus via ovsdb for vhost user ports and we had one other use in the pyroute2 patch series."}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-01-29 15:18:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

commit_message:
Add memoize function using oslo.cache

Added memoize decorator function based in oslo.cache.
This new function is used to store the result of function
'_ovs_supports_mtu_requests' in 'vif_plug_ovs'.

Closes-Bug: #1696501

Change-Id: I568ec94a77d54fc697514014238a8536b035c598

commit_message:
Fix policy function check error

Change in I8a346e55bb98e4e22e0c14a614c45d493d20feb4 to make
POLICY_CHECK_FUNCTION a string rather than a function was incomplete.

The case in horizon/tables/base.py is problematic in particular and results in
raising the TypeError: 'str' object is not callable error.

There is another instance that is not problematic, but is changed for
consistency sake.

Change-Id: Ifc616e322eb38ec7e5ac218f7f3c5ccec52e40f4
Closes-Bug: #1818292

commit_message:
Add DIB_APT_MINIMAL_CREATE_INTERFACES toggle

Add a DIB_APT_MINIMAL_CREATE_INTERFACES boolean to the debootstrap
element which functions identically to
DIB_YUM_MINIMAL_CREATE_INTERFACES in the yum-minimal element.

This can be used to disable the creation of the
/etc/network/interfaces.d/eth[01] dhcp configuration files, which
are not needed on systems where cloud-init or other means are used
to configure networking.

The flag is enabled by default to keep creating the dhcp interface
files, maintaining backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I1fdaca8350a5ceefd9e437af4fd000ce6a3ee7f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-01 08:24:29.000000000', 'message': 'Detect redirects within PythonImageUploader

Some registries might have redirects at some point.
In addition, the redirection target might provide an invalide TLS
certificate, meaning the whole requests.Session will fail unless
we pass "verify=False".

This patch adds a new method that will intercept the redirects prior
any "get" call in order to ensure the request will succeed.

Change-Id: I10c89142624c394a9b67eb80a5cd44d512640080
Closes-Bug: #1817360
'}]
commit_message:
Detect redirects within PythonImageUploader

Some registries might have redirects at some point.
In addition, the redirection target might provide an invalide TLS
certificate, meaning the whole requests.Session will fail unless
we pass "verify=False".

This patch adds a new method that will intercept the redirects prior
any "get" call in order to ensure the request will succeed.

Change-Id: I10c89142624c394a9b67eb80a5cd44d512640080
Closes-Bug: #1817360

subject: [Downstream Only] Inject osp15 dev registry in NO_VERIFY_REGISTRIES
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-05 05:59:19.000000000', 'message': "[Downstream Only] Inject osp15 dev registry in NO_VERIFY_REGISTRIES

This will allow to deploy containers while still in Beta/Dev state.
The listed registry has a redirect to an TLS host with a specific,
Red Hat internal CA that isn't installed by default on the systems.

Change-Id: I4ea63dc32e1d7923e814c135730f77d39fc5b5fc
"}]
commit_message:
[Downstream Only] Inject osp15 dev registry in NO_VERIFY_REGISTRIES

This will allow to deploy containers while still in Beta/Dev state.
The listed registry has a redirect to an TLS host with a specific,
Red Hat internal CA that isn't installed by default on the systems.

Change-Id: I4ea63dc32e1d7923e814c135730f77d39fc5b5fc

commit_message:
Update the log message for ilo drivers

This patch updates the log message for ``ilo``
drivers and extends the warning to Gen9 as well.
The proliantutils fix which added active NIC inspection
for Gen9 has been reverted back in
I02c27d820b27bd532f23ab7ef276b39f868f5205

story: #2004950
task: #29366

Change-Id: Ifbffb782c10b952bfb3498b882f07d313d410356

commit_message:
make ceilometer client import optional

on ImportError set HAS_CEILCLIENT to false

Without this none of the watcher componenets can be started for master
as well as rocky because the ceilometercleint was deprecated.

Using the variable the support for ceilometer can be gradually removed
from master

A backport to rocky will allow using watcher without ceilometerclient.

Change-Id: I3beb0fb8f0a8e8e0a22acaf6bdeca492836bbee2

Coco, pls add "in-use" to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/624138/5/cyborg/objects/driver_objects/driver_attach_handle.py in your new patch. :)'}, {'account_id': 28221, 'date': '2019-03-05 01:39:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

What is the difference between cpid and attach handle?
Will attach handle be used to encode information about an accelerator function being bound to a VFIO driver and assigned to a VM?'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-03-05 03:19:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> What is the difference between cpid and attach handle?
Control Path ID is the ID of the control path interface to the device. Typically, this is a PF's BDF. An attach handle is the ID of the data path interface. E.g. VF's BDF.

 > Will attach handle be used to encode information about an
 > accelerator function being bound to a VFIO driver and assigned to a
 > VM?
The attach handle has a type ('PCI', 'mediated device', etc.) and an info field that provides the type-dependent ID. For PCI, this would be a BDF. For mdev, this would be an UUID. At this point, we don't itend to provide any vfio/driver info because that is not relevant to attaching to a VM."}]

commit_message:
Add New Driver OVO.

Driver OVO is used for drivers to report to agent. It contains the
layered objects as well as the functions in order to operate the
DB. The design of driver OVO is reference to:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/
1XLQtvyGJeEgo3ztBQiufWLF-E7S7yGLaYrme8iUPtA0/edit

Change-Id: I997a251673e1b7cfdb035d58889781c6943b3db7

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-04 10:42:59.000000000', 'message': "Switch federation check jobs to opensuse

Ubuntu Xenial is nearing its end of life, so it's not ideal to keep
testing on it and the QA team is driving an effort to move everyone away
from it[1]. However, our non-voting federation jobs rely on the
Shibboleth service provider Apache module, which does not work on Ubuntu
Bionic[2]. Since the keystone devstack plugin now has support for CentOS
and openSUSE, let's transition away from Ubuntu for this testing.

The reason to choose openSUSE rather then CentOS is that the Shibboleth
service provider package for CentOS relies on an external repository and
is not included in either the base CentOS distro or EPEL. The
shibboleth-sp package for openSUSE is included in the base distro
packages.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/003129.html
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/shibboleth-sp2/+bug/1776489

Change-Id: I89a8af9c45ff513c854c048880854990a6d12278
"}]
commit_message:
Switch federation check jobs to opensuse

Ubuntu Xenial is nearing its end of life, so it's not ideal to keep
testing on it and the QA team is driving an effort to move everyone away
from it[1]. However, our non-voting federation jobs rely on the
Shibboleth service provider Apache module, which does not work on Ubuntu
Bionic[2]. Since the keystone devstack plugin now has support for CentOS
and openSUSE, let's transition away from Ubuntu for this testing.

The reason to choose openSUSE rather then CentOS is that the Shibboleth
service provider package for CentOS relies on an external repository and
is not included in either the base CentOS distro or EPEL. The
shibboleth-sp package for openSUSE is included in the base distro
packages.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/003129.html
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/shibboleth-sp2/+bug/1776489

Change-Id: I89a8af9c45ff513c854c048880854990a6d12278

commit_message:
[WIP] honor ipmi_port in serial console drivers

teach the ipmitool driver about _get_ipmitool_args and use that in all
cases that we want to build an ipmitool command line.   this solves
the problem that the serial console drivers were failing to honor the
ipmi_port setting in driver_info, while it was being correctly used
for power state, etc.

Change-Id: I4d8156473f4c2bfa7702fee9f4de192b213cac6c
Story: 2005138
Task: 29826

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 10:13:54.000000000', 'message': 'Specify Octavia amphora image hw_architecture property in Glance

In the case of a multi-architecture cloud, Nova will try to schedule an
Amphora to a non-x86_64 architecture compute node, which will fail the
load balancer creation in Octavia.

This patch explicitly specifies the Amphora image hw_architecture property
when the image is being uploaded to glance. By doing so, it hints the Nova
scheduler to the compute nodes hw_architecture into account when it schedules
an Amphora.

The default for hw_architecture is x86_64, which resembles the current
behavior since this is the only image type that we ship.

Change-Id: Ia7be6503a40e08d0d1f7f4d89132c9e9b5bd6704
'}, {'created': '2019-02-28 10:16:00.000000000', 'message': 'Specify Octavia amphora image hw_architecture property in Glance

In the case of a multi-architecture cloud, Nova will try to schedule an
Amphora to a non-x86_64 architecture compute node, which will fail the
load balancer creation in Octavia.

This patch explicitly specifies the Amphora image hw_architecture
property when the image is being uploaded to glance. By doing so, it
hints the Nova scheduler to the compute nodes hw_architecture into
account when it schedules an Amphora.

The default for hw_architecture is x86_64, which resembles the current
behavior since this is the only image type that we ship.

Change-Id: Ia7be6503a40e08d0d1f7f4d89132c9e9b5bd6704
'}, {'created': '2019-02-28 11:31:11.000000000', 'message': 'Specify Octavia amphora image hw_architecture property in Glance

In the case of a multi-architecture cloud, Nova will try to schedule an
Amphora to a non-x86_64 architecture compute node, which will fail the
load balancer creation in Octavia.

This patch explicitly specifies the Amphora image hw_architecture
property when the image is being uploaded to Glance. By doing so, it
hints the Nova scheduler which compute nodes to take into
account when it schedules an Amphora instance.

The default for hw_architecture is x86_64, which resembles the current
behavior since this is the only image type that we ship.

Change-Id: Ia7be6503a40e08d0d1f7f4d89132c9e9b5bd6704

In the case of a multi-architecture cloud, Nova will try to schedule an
Amphora to a non-x86_64 architecture compute node, which will fail the
load balancer creation in Octavia.

property when the image is being uploaded to Glance. By doing so, it
hints the Nova scheduler which compute nodes to take into

commit_message:
Specify Octavia amphora image hw_architecture property in Glance

In the case of a multi-architecture cloud, Nova will try to schedule an
Amphora to a non-x86_64 architecture compute node, which will fail the
load balancer creation in Octavia.

This patch explicitly specifies the Amphora image hw_architecture
property when the image is being uploaded to Glance. By doing so, it
hints the Nova scheduler which compute nodes to take into
account when it schedules an Amphora instance.

The default for hw_architecture is x86_64, which resembles the current
behavior since this is the only image type that we ship.

Closes-Bug: #1818563

Change-Id: Ia7be6503a40e08d0d1f7f4d89132c9e9b5bd6704

commit_message:
Doc: run tempest tests without tox

It looks we cannot run Zun tempest tests in tox environment anymore.
This commit updates the document to switch to non-tox command to
run tests.

commit_message:
Clean up func tests ahead of py3

- ConfigParser.set() requires that the value be a string
- The stdlib HTTP client responses don't have a body property
- We might raise a ResponseError with response=None
- Bodies should be bytes
- Headers should be strings
- Make containers()/files() return native strings
- file() isn't a thing on py3
- format should be a parm, not a header
- Switch sorted() to use key instead of cmp
- Use integer division explicitly

Change-Id: I99d3eebc9d7ec4e8b295352294b831492135c568

commit_message:
Use a placement conf when testing report client

It turns out that the independent wsgi interceptors in
test_report_client were using nova's global configuration
when creating the intercepts using code from placement.
This was working because until [1] placement's set of conf
options had not diverged from nova's and nova still has
placement_database config settings.

This change takes advantage of new functionality in the
PlacementFixture to allow the fixtur to manage config and
database, but _not_ run the interceptor. This means it
can set up a config that is later used by the independent
interceptors that are used in the report client tests.

[1] Ie43a69be8b75250d9deca6a911eda7b722ef8648

Change-Id: I05326e0f917ca1b9a6ef8d3bd463f68bd00e217e
Closes-Bug: #1818560
Depends-On: I8c36f35dbe85b0c0db1a5b6b5389b160b68ca488

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-04 20:07:26.000000000', 'message': "Make the PlacementFixture usable without intercept

There are cases where it is necessary to use the PlacementFixture
without it running a wsgi-intercept, for example when you'd  like
to run an indepdendent wsgi-intercept, as in the nova tests that
exercise the report client.

In the bug listed as partial below those report client tests were
using a nova conf global to initialize the wsgi intercept. They
just happened to be working because that CONF has the required
configuration settings. When placement's conf diverged [1] things
broken. A nova change which depends on this one will resolve the
bug.

Note that as a part of this change, the code which deletes
'sync_on_startup' (the new conf option) before configuring the
database, is adapted to be more flexible. There really is only
one conf setting that is required to start the placement database,
connect, and we'd like to make it possible for people to set
just that when doing tests or experiments and not have to worry
about extraneous optional things.

Partial-Bug: #1818560

[1] Ie43a69be8b75250d9deca6a911eda7b722ef8648

Change-Id: I8c36f35dbe85b0c0db1a5b6b5389b160b68ca488

commit_message:
Make the PlacementFixture usable without intercept

There are cases where it is necessary to use the PlacementFixture
without it running a wsgi-intercept, for example when you'd like
to run an indepdendent wsgi-intercept, as in the nova tests that
exercise the report client.

In the bug listed as partial below those report client tests were
using a nova conf global to initialize the wsgi intercept. They
just happened to be working because that CONF has the required
configuration settings. When placement's conf diverged [1] things
broke. A nova change which depends on this one will resolve the
bug.

Note that as a part of this change, the code which deletes
'sync_on_startup' (the new conf option) before configuring the
database, is adapted to be more flexible. There really is only
one conf setting that is required to start the placement database,
connection, and we'd like to make it possible for people to set
just that when doing tests or experiments and not have to worry
about extraneous optional things.

Some parameter descriptions are added to the PlacementFixture
__init__.

We should add more robust testing to all three of PlacementFixture,
fixtures.Database, and PlacementDirect, but at the moment we are
trying to fix a gate blocking bug.

commit_message:
flatten database service Redis

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration.

With this patch the baremetal version of database service Redis
has been removed.

Change-Id: I530ee8196e1d4b81ae4886b234e1a530cf34becf
Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

I'm happy with this compromise. Currently the 26 limit is only libvirt, isn't discoverable via the API, and is arbitrary. Other drivers have similar limits, but which are unchecked until late. This allows operators to set this to whatever they decide is best for load/usability or other limitations they have. revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-01 20:16:33.000000000', 'message': 'Handle secret strings correctly

In python3 we need to make sure our passwords and secrets are strings
and not binary since when we try and json.dumps a dict with binary
values it fails.

Change-Id: I61568e00babcaf3c8106cd71c25bb7f645c9237d
Related-Blueprint: python3-support
'}, {'created': '2019-03-01 22:46:05.000000000', 'message': 'Handle secret strings correctly

In python3 we need to make sure our passwords and secrets are strings
and not binary since when we try and json.dumps a dict with binary
values it fails.

Change-Id: I61568e00babcaf3c8106cd71c25bb7f645c9237d
Related-Blueprint: python3-support
'}]
commit_message:
Handle secret strings correctly

In python3 we need to make sure our passwords and secrets are strings
and not binary since when we try and json.dumps a dict with binary
values it fails.

Change-Id: I61568e00babcaf3c8106cd71c25bb7f645c9237d
Related-Blueprint: python3-support

commit_message:
Drop the role service override for ovb

We should be using the shipped roles and not overriding these services
as it leads to OVB not reflecting the actual deployment and we have to
manage this when we need to add new default services.

Change-Id: I992056a497e16576ab5710f9cbbc8a599d822222

commit_message:
Fix the exception when creating rbd incremental backup

The exception is raised from _snap_exists in ceph.py.
After base_rbd.close, there will be exception when getting
the snap from snaps.

Change-Id: I9984aa9fece48dabc236178a39baa809338662da
Closes-Bug: #1818314

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 17:10:01.000000000', 'message': "Avoid BadRequest error log on volume attachment

At the gate, only AttachVolumeNegativeTest makes nova-api output
error log as a negative test case like:

  ERROR nova.volume.cinder [None req-dcc8814f-7439-44c8-872e-86ea51f4b319
   tempest-AttachVolumeNegativeTest-431575524
   tempest-AttachVolumeNegativeTest-431575524]
   [instance: ca526f93-e723-4372-a1c1-4fa03ffc1bd7]
   Create attachment failed for volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418.
   Error: Invalid volume: Volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418 status
     must be available or downloading (HTTP 400)
     (Request-ID: req-5e5074ea-cd12-43ed-9355-5db539ca9720)
   Code: 400:
   BadRequest: Invalid volume: Volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418
     status must be available or downloading (HTTP 400)
     (Request-ID: req-5e5074ea-cd12-43ed-9355-5db539ca9720)

Operators don't need to take care of BadRequest cases in general because
that is due to end user mistakes. So this patch makes nova-api avoiding
such error log case.

Closes-Bug: #1797237

Change-Id: I22d9d974822282ffc3c0942d4766b135717dd369
(cherry picked from commit 5bef746c9b50537dde47278a208c4457b42896d0)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid BadRequest error log on volume attachment

At the gate, only AttachVolumeNegativeTest makes nova-api output
error log as a negative test case like:

  ERROR nova.volume.cinder [None req-dcc8814f-7439-44c8-872e-86ea51f4b319
   tempest-AttachVolumeNegativeTest-431575524
   tempest-AttachVolumeNegativeTest-431575524]
   [instance: ca526f93-e723-4372-a1c1-4fa03ffc1bd7]
   Create attachment failed for volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418.
   Error: Invalid volume: Volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418 status
     must be available or downloading (HTTP 400)
     (Request-ID: req-5e5074ea-cd12-43ed-9355-5db539ca9720)
   Code: 400:
   BadRequest: Invalid volume: Volume 0a6e6a92-f095-4ab7-803c-826934824418
     status must be available or downloading (HTTP 400)
     (Request-ID: req-5e5074ea-cd12-43ed-9355-5db539ca9720)

Operators don't need to take care of BadRequest cases in general because
that is due to end user mistakes. So this patch makes nova-api avoiding
such error log case.

Closes-Bug: #1797237

Change-Id: I22d9d974822282ffc3c0942d4766b135717dd369
(cherry picked from commit 5bef746c9b50537dde47278a208c4457b42896d0)

so limit some of those tests to linux only.

subject: Refactor _get_trees_matching_all()
messages:
[{'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-28 02:47:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-28 20:47:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

I fear the concept of RPCandidateList may be seen as a step backwards from the de-object-ization of *List things in placement. However, I think this has merit. It certainly makes the _get_trees_matching_all code more intuitive to read.

There are some things I think should be crisped up a bit. But overall I like where this is going.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-03-01 11:40:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-03-01 12:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

I think this is close, just a couple more tweaks...'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-03-01 12:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

...and buyin from other stakeholders.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-03-01 13:52:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I agree that this provides an interface improvement over the existing situation and that it is unlike the *List objects that I'm trying to remove.

Given that it is a fairly self contained lump of obscure set logic, it would probably be reasonable to create a unit test for the RPCandidateList for two reason:

* make sure it works and continues to work
* the tests can be a sort of educational map to how it works

So +1  on the concept, -1 to indicate there's a bit more work to do."}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-03-03 04:36:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-03-03 07:01:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

This looks good. The logic in the unit test seems fine, but there's an odd provider that seems to have multiple roots, noted inline.

I don't think it affects the test coverage though, so I'm happy to approve."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-03-04 10:12:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

Looks good, maybe get the naming confusion in a followup.

Because we do coverage with python3 the new module isn't 100% covered, but that's fine, it would be if we also did python2."}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-03-05 00:57:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 02:47:00.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor _get_trees_matching_all()

_get_trees_matching_all() is used to get allocation candidates,
but it is difficult to read using specific indexes like p[0].
This patch makes it more readable adding a new helper class,
`RPCandidateList`, which have several explanatory functions.

This is also a preparation for adding crisp debug logs coming
in a following patch.

Change-Id: If815d98a92e411b8006f147cd5ccf419e90f06fc

commit_message:
Refactor _get_trees_matching_all()

_get_trees_matching_all() is used to get allocation candidates,
but it is difficult to read using specific indexes like p[0].
This patch makes it more readable adding a new helper class,
`RPCandidateList`, which have several explanatory functions.

This is also a preparation for adding crisp debug logs coming
in a following patch.

Change-Id: If815d98a92e411b8006f147cd5ccf419e90f06fc

commit_message:
Workflow and action for deployment failures

Adds a new workflow and corresponding custom action for querying the
ansible failures that occurred during a plan deployment with
config-download.

Relies on the json-error.py ansible callback plugin to provide a
structured data format for the errors.

Change-Id: I16d2dd0b3022cd5964919d07dd0ec603490a3ed7
(cherry picked from commit e8c521acf13622fdd30350aeaf4dd571f2053d15)

commit_message:
Add common methods to use for sending notification

This patch adds the methods that masakari uses when sending
notifications.

Co-Authored-By: Shilpa Devharakar <Shilpa.Devharakar@nttdata.com>

Change-Id: Iee57249b5bc2659e41589b5c6c98eb7eec0bc1b3
Partial-Implements: bp notifications-in-masakari

commit_message:
Define objects used for notification

This patch adds the object definition used for notification.

Co-Authored-By: Shilpa Devharakar <Shilpa.Devharakar@nttdata.com>

Change-Id: If6e67b67fa30b41a1dffac374f8a1b395b33ada3
Partial-Implements: bp notifications-in-masakari

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-05 05:04:45.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Add notifying function

This patch added the function to notify the progress of Masakari's API
and recovery process.
After this patch is applied, Masakari sends notifications at the timing
of the start and end of APIs and recovery processes.

TODO:
- Complete the implementation of test codes, and resolve errors in py27.
- Add doc/notification_samples/ .

Change-Id: Iad3f487ef14effb41484014e5426117129543f5c
"}, {'created': '2017-06-15 01:46:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add necessary constants and methods for RPC notification

As first step of adding notify functionality to masakari, this patch

commit_message:
Add necessary constants and methods for RPC notification

As first step of adding notify functionality to masakari, this patch
adds the necessary constants and methods for RPC notification.

Co-Authored-By: Shilpa Devharakar <Shilpa.Devharakar@nttdata.com>

Change-Id: Iad3f487ef14effb41484014e5426117129543f5c
Partial-Implements: bp notifications-in-masakari

commit_message:
Run all jobs by default using python3

This patch implements the community wide goal to run all jobs by
default using python3.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ie235cbffcfc69eee96c4b34358467009ca34ef9f

subject: Move project to the official openstack organization
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-12-19 13:38:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2018-12-19 13:44:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Do we need to use launchpad to track issues?
If yes to the previous question, how to create a bug tracker on launchpad for this project?
Github issues was disabled for this project and we are redirect on pull request page when we try to access issues page.
 
- https://bugs.launchpad.net/karma-subunit-reporter
- https://github.com/openstack/karma-subunit-reporter/issues'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2018-12-19 13:53:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can you review please?'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-03-03 16:38:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

> Do we need to use launchpad to track issues?
 > If yes to the previous question, how to create a bug tracker on
 > launchpad for this project?
 > Github issues was disabled for this project and we are redirect on
 > pull request page when we try to access issues page.
 > 
 > - https://bugs.launchpad.net/karma-subunit-reporter
 > - https://github.com/openstack/karma-subunit-reporter/issues

we no more create the LP and we do not have central LP for QA tools. I am ok to keep issue path as of now.  once we move it to storyboard then, I can fix it. 

1 comment inline.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-03-04 14:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-03-04 23:52:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Remove service policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

By incorporating system-scope and default roles, we've effectively
made these policies obsolete. We can simplify what we maintain and
provide a more consistent, unified view of default service behavior by
removing them.

Change-Id: Ifa2282481ee3fc544c1d50ac8e8972b0d3a5332e
Closes-Bug: 1804462

commit_message:
Fix version return incorrect when endpoint url end without /

when request to cinder endpoint url end without /
$ curl http://127.0.0.1/volume
the version href return incorrect, like below:
"href": "http://127.0.0.1/v2/"
"href": "http://127.0.0.1/v3/"
This patch will always add a '/' to the endpoint url end.

Closes-bug: #1816793
Change-Id: I6b0f47fc5b11c44a767e0ebfe2929e560c5f5432
(cherry picked from commit 175aaa879d8b940d800e1b96e8871bd350798038)

[{'created': '2019-03-04 16:19:23.000000000', 'message': 'Correct upcoming release name in template URLs

The future_release expansion variable was being incorrectly set to
the name of the end release from the electorate contribution
timeframe. Its intended use however was redundant with the release
variable. Remove future_release entirely and just use release in
those templates.

Change-Id: I7df3592112d543b52b06c99bfbc05107bfde45f8
'}]
commit_message:
Correct upcoming release name in template URLs

The future_release expansion variable was being incorrectly set to
the name of the end release from the electorate contribution
timeframe. Its intended use however was redundant with the release
variable. Remove future_release entirely and just use release in
those templates.

Change-Id: I7df3592112d543b52b06c99bfbc05107bfde45f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-20 11:07:41.000000000', 'message': "Fail to live migration if instance has NUMA topology

Live migration is currently totally broken if a NUMA topology is
present. This affects everything that's been regrettably stuffed in with
NUMA topology including CPU pinning, hugepage support and emulator
thread support. Side effects can range from simple unexpected
performance hits (due to instances running on the same cores) to
complete failures (due to instance cores or huge pages being mapped to
CPUs/NUMA nodes that don't exist on the destination host).

Until such a time as we resolve these issues, we should alert users to
the fact that such issues exist. A workaround option is provided for
operators that _really_ need the broken behavior, but it's defaulted to
False to highlight the brokenness of this feature to unsuspecting
operators.

The related nova change is I217fba9138132b107e9d62895d699d238392e761

The proposed change allows to configure the 'enable_numa_live_migration'
workarounds option through TripleO. By default this feature will be
disabled for NUMA topology instances.

Depends-On: I16794fbfef0e6e83d3fcebb9e6bc2fcf478ebf72
Change-Id: I523756b418afe1827490c936966af8936ffdbaa6
(cherry picked from commit f7bc59d4b8d37b4523156773e9933eb90ab50b9b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fail to live migration if instance has NUMA topology

Live migration is currently totally broken if a NUMA topology is
present. This affects everything that's been regrettably stuffed in with
NUMA topology including CPU pinning, hugepage support and emulator
thread support. Side effects can range from simple unexpected
performance hits (due to instances running on the same cores) to
complete failures (due to instance cores or huge pages being mapped to
CPUs/NUMA nodes that don't exist on the destination host).

Until such a time as we resolve these issues, we should alert users to
the fact that such issues exist. A workaround option is provided for
operators that _really_ need the broken behavior, but it's defaulted to
False to highlight the brokenness of this feature to unsuspecting
operators.

The related nova change is I217fba9138132b107e9d62895d699d238392e761

The proposed change allows to configure the 'enable_numa_live_migration'
workarounds option through TripleO. By default this feature will be
disabled for NUMA topology instances.

Depends-On: I16794fbfef0e6e83d3fcebb9e6bc2fcf478ebf72
Change-Id: I523756b418afe1827490c936966af8936ffdbaa6
(cherry picked from commit f7bc59d4b8d37b4523156773e9933eb90ab50b9b)

commit_message:
Add user variables to the virthost connection

Without these variables, the user connecting to
the virthost will default to stack- which will
not work with zuul.

Change-Id: Ieffcccabcc92ae99cf9672c9acb8c83f6657812a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-30 20:36:21.000000000', 'message': "Avoid using 'truncate' on Windows

The Windows SMB driver has been broken by a recent change [1],
which is attempting to handle info file permissions, using the
'truncate' command along the way, which is not available on Windows.

We're not handling file permissions on Windows, so we can just skip
this step, avoiding this issue.

Change-Id: I1f92cef19cd2eed7ba845210f7ff89d88ba78f49
Closes-Bug: #1811369
(cherry picked from commit 133617828c37db78bcc71c5106c90818e0bebc3c)
(cherry picked from commit 8230238365f5a8b356d1b0af614a62d37aab21d3)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_remotefs.py
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid using 'truncate' on Windows

The Windows SMB driver has been broken by a recent change [1],
which is attempting to handle info file permissions, using the
'truncate' command along the way, which is not available on Windows.

We're not handling file permissions on Windows, so we can just skip
this step, avoiding this issue.

Change-Id: I1f92cef19cd2eed7ba845210f7ff89d88ba78f49
Closes-Bug: #1811369
(cherry picked from commit 133617828c37db78bcc71c5106c90818e0bebc3c)
(cherry picked from commit 8230238365f5a8b356d1b0af614a62d37aab21d3)
Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_remotefs.py

commit_message:
Revert "Restart all L3 agents in test that check no packet loss in HA routers"

Unfortunately it still sometimes fails because restart was still happened in
very short pause between agents.
I will need to figure out some other possible solution for that issue.

This reverts commit bdd35405548c1d60072cd71ef648a724bf1d31d2.

Change-Id: Iaf9d1be3255e941c5fe227943535ab7c6905253c

This is to resolve name conflicts of reources in case if multiple
releases required for single deployment of ceph cluster

[{'created': '2019-02-05 13:35:57.000000000', 'message': "Metadata agent: fetch ovn-bridge from OVSDB and not from config

Prior to this patch, metadata agent was fetching the OVN bridge
from the settings but this could lead to inconsistencies if the
config is different from the actual OVSDB configuration as
ovn-controller would be using one bridge and Metadata agent
another one.

In order to eliminate these inconsistencies, this patch is
changing the behavior of the agent so that it reads the OVN
bridge from OVSDB as ovn-controller does. Also, when the
agent is restarted, if the bridge has changed, it'll plug all
the VETH pairs to the right bridge and unplug it from the older
one (this is handy for the migration from ML2/OVS where an
intermediate OVS bridge is used temporarily).

The config option is not removed by this patch but ignored to
avoid issues when it doesn't match OVSDB configuration.

Change-Id: I33f3509b8e5fe0398a27d35923e46f0409a1935d
Closes-Bug: #1799216
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3e5d9213aa9d59029107ba51d6c0876d6d7d8b2a)
"}]
commit_message:
Metadata agent: fetch ovn-bridge from OVSDB and not from config

Prior to this patch, metadata agent was fetching the OVN bridge
from the settings but this could lead to inconsistencies if the
config is different from the actual OVSDB configuration as
ovn-controller would be using one bridge and Metadata agent
another one.

In order to eliminate these inconsistencies, this patch is
changing the behavior of the agent so that it reads the OVN
bridge from OVSDB as ovn-controller does. Also, when the
agent is restarted, if the bridge has changed, it'll plug all
the VETH pairs to the right bridge and unplug it from the older
one (this is handy for the migration from ML2/OVS where an
intermediate OVS bridge is used temporarily).

The config option is not removed by this patch but ignored to
avoid issues when it doesn't match OVSDB configuration.

Change-Id: I33f3509b8e5fe0398a27d35923e46f0409a1935d
Closes-Bug: #1799216
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 3e5d9213aa9d59029107ba51d6c0876d6d7d8b2a)

[{'created': '2018-11-20 17:48:35.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Optionally migrate database at service startup

In some use cases, notably testing, it can be handy to do database
migrations when the web service starts up. This changes adds that
functionality, controlled by a [placement_database]/sync option that
defaults to False.

When True, `migration.upgrade('head')` will be called before the
placement application is made available to the wsgi server. Alembic
protects us against concurrency issues and prevents re-doing already
done migrations.

This means that it is possible, with the help of oslo.config>=6.7.0
to do something like this:

    OS_PLACEMENT_DATABASE__CONNECTION=sqlite:// \
    OS_PLACEMENT_DATABASE__SYNC=True \
    OS_API__AUTH_STRATEGY=noauth2 \
    .tox/py36/bin/placement-api

and have a ready to go placement api using an in RAM sql database.

This is probably useful, but also probably needs some discussion and
documentation to bring to some form of correctness, thus the WIP.

Change-Id: Ie43a69be8b75250d9deca6a911eda7b722ef8648

commit_message:
Optionally migrate database at service startup

In some use cases, notably testing, it can be handy to do database
migrations when the web service starts up. This changes adds that
functionality, controlled by a [placement_database]/sync_on_startup
option that defaults to False.

When True, `migration.upgrade('head')` will be called before the
placement application is made available to the wsgi server. Alembic
protects us against concurrency issues and prevents re-doing already
done migrations.

This means that it is possible, with the help of oslo.config>=6.7.0
to do something like this:

    OS_PLACEMENT_DATABASE__CONNECTION=sqlite:// \
    OS_PLACEMENT_DATABASE__SYNC_ON_STARTUP=True \
    OS_API__AUTH_STRATEGY=noauth2 \
    .tox/py36/bin/placement-api

and have a ready to go placement api using an in-RAM sql database.

A reno is added.

Change-Id: Ie43a69be8b75250d9deca6a911eda7b722ef8648

commit_message:
Move 'attach.end' notify to attachment_complete

Since microversion 3.44, we update `attachemnt_update` to return
connector and make volume to 'attaching', and add a new api
`attachment_complete` to change volume status to 'in-use', that means
the end of attachment is changed to `attachment_complete`.

But the 'attach.end' notify is still send in attachment_update, which
is unexpected. So, in this patch we move 'attach.end' notify to
`attachment_complete`.

Change-Id: I86dad7afb52d2d253799b543f484e2d55f6e9e6d
Closes-bug: #1808941

commit_message:
Add sample_default for thread_pool_size Opt

When generating a sample config, this shows
the real default behavior rather than recording
a number at sample config generation time.

Change-Id: I39e5200f795b52e61ab424a5fda4749086e458e2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-04 06:45:39.000000000', 'message': 'DVR edge router: avoid accidental centralized floating IP remove

Need to pass centralized floating IPs as preserve_ips to
_external_gateway_added during DVR router update.
Otherwise IP addresses will be deleted from gw device in certain case.
The case is when a router with active centralized floating IPs is
being scheduled to a new dvr_snat L3 agent (rescheduled from a down one).
Please see corresponding traces in the bug description.

Change-Id: Iaeb9fbed73144df6fcd9092c665ed19986e85f4d
Closes-bug: #1817306
(cherry picked from commit 1ee18775a99492f445f1fb29e2d4639cbdff613d)

Need to pass centralized floating IPs as preserve_ips to
_external_gateway_added during DVR router update.
Otherwise IP addresses will be deleted from gw device in certain case.
The case is when a router with active centralized floating IPs is
being scheduled to a new dvr_snat L3 agent (rescheduled from a down one).
Please see corresponding traces in the bug description.

(cherry picked from commit 1ee18775a99492f445f1fb29e2d4639cbdff613d)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR edge router: avoid accidental centralized floating IP remove

Need to pass centralized floating IPs as preserve_ips to
_external_gateway_added during DVR router update.
Otherwise IP addresses will be deleted from gw device in certain case.
The case is when a router with active centralized floating IPs is
being scheduled to a new dvr_snat L3 agent (rescheduled from a down one).
Please see corresponding traces in the bug description.

Change-Id: Iaeb9fbed73144df6fcd9092c665ed19986e85f4d
Closes-bug: #1817306
(cherry picked from commit 1ee18775a99492f445f1fb29e2d4639cbdff613d)

commit_message:
Disable verification for Keystone session in Swift

The swift backend did not make use of the insecure option in
the config when creating a Keystone session, enable or disable
verification based on it.

Co-Authored-By: Steve Kowalik <steven@wedontsleep.org>
Change-Id: Ic783afde7ae8af522480996fdf91ed54e02e72d2
Closes-Bug: #1606268
(cherry picked from commit 54b7ccbb9b3cc53dacb368c9953fc2677690d878)

commit_message:
Make tox tips job actually run sdk tests

When keystoneauth or os-client-config run this job, they'll run
their own tests, not openstacksdk's. Whoops.

Change-Id: Ia4a421dc4b2e8c3d682ebce2474a436490988363

commit_message:
Use overlay2 in tools/setup_Redhat.sh

Currently CentOS gates use btrfs storage driver and
create /docker device backing btrfs.

This patch is to sync the gate run with Ubuntu.
(post-Trusty) does not use btrfs, only overlay2.

Change-Id: Ic5caa8cf0271b21f71f03fd33c35b3c7bc93ccf4

commit_message:
Add neutron-rootwrap-daemon

This patch introduces neutron-rootwrap-daemon[1]
to neutron.conf and sudoers.d files which provide us
improvements in performance such as openratins
with DHCP agents.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/kilo/rootwrap-daemon-mode.html

Change-Id: I659b8fb695dce5b9997de2acc770b1e7fbeae6d4

subject: Not set fip to ERROR if it exists on device
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-04 20:07:21.000000000', 'message': 'Not set fip to ERROR if it exists on device

The centralized floating IP can exist on the router device
due to some reasons like: uncleaned fip addr, and especially
multiple IP addr adding action: HA router _add_vip() and
Edge router add_ip_address().
This patch catches the IpAddressAlreadyExists error if fip
was already set on the device, and still process next step.

Change-Id: I324f6b96baa0520a0f7ef62a83d81864d7b27999
Closes-Bug: #1811213
'}]
commit_message:
Not set fip to ERROR if it exists on device

The centralized floating IP can exist on the router device
due to some reasons like: uncleaned fip addr, and especially
multiple IP addr adding action: HA router _add_vip() and
Edge router add_ip_address().
This patch catches the IpAddressAlreadyExists error if fip
was already set on the device, and still process next step.

Change-Id: I324f6b96baa0520a0f7ef62a83d81864d7b27999
Closes-Bug: #1811213

[{'created': '2018-09-12 09:18:50.000000000', 'message': "Remove kuryr legacy job and move the Zuulv3 one to experimental gate

As current kuryr job is not even installing networking-ovn nor kuryr,
this patch is removing it. Even if we decide to fix it [0], its value
is still unclear since we would be depending on more projects and
we would have to run kuryr's tempest tests instead of ours.

As kuryr folks are setting up a new job to their gate using OVN as

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543864/

Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 71a5d899750079e11edaa84a860dfca72275143f)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove kuryr legacy job and move the Zuulv3 one to experimental gate

As current kuryr job is not even installing networking-ovn nor kuryr,
this patch is removing it. Even if we decide to fix it [0], its value
is still unclear since we would be depending on more projects and
we would have to run kuryr's tempest tests instead of ours.

As kuryr folks are setting up a new job to their gate using OVN as
a backend [1], let's remove this job from networking-ovn gate for now
and run their Zuulv3 job to the experimental pipeline.

Closes-bug: #1748857

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543419/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543864/

Change-Id: Iea69d16a6ae919404987643732ee3ac6582c31a7
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 71a5d899750079e11edaa84a860dfca72275143f)

commit_message:
Use env python instead of /usr/bin/python

If running with tox venv, the python version (where all the
requirements are installed) might be different than /usr/bin/python.

We should use the one in the env.

Change-Id: Ic69282b289fefeafa5a63b6da284f44c4b3c4b15

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

I think the glance_service_publicuri_proto indicates the protocol the glance API is using. However we must declare the refferer's protocol and address in the CORS allowed origins. Which is the horizon's protocol and address."}, {'account_id': 27593, 'date': '2018-11-18 15:16:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Adds protocol to glance_cors_allowed_origin var

When the horizon runs on https, then the IP is not enough in
the allowed_origins, the protocoll must be included as well.

Change-Id: Icd806d98b74671278ea17837107ee9bb14f1b303
Closes-Bug: #1799910

subject: Add method to tox to use local neutron-lib with unit tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5367, 'name': 'boden', 'email': 'bodenvmw@gmail.com', 'username': 'boden'}, {'_account_id': 10980, 'name': 'Doug Wiegley', 'email': 'dougwig@parkside.io', 'username': 'dougw'}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16688, 'name': 'Rodolfo Alonso', 'email': 'ralonsoh@redhat.com', 'username': 'rodolfo-alonso-hernandez'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26622, 'name': 'Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'neutron_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'neutron_hyperv_ci'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 10980, 'date': '2019-02-19 21:07:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-02-19 21:22:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/638012/1 : FAILURE in 14m 27s'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-02-20 15:55:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10980, 'date': '2019-02-20 19:40:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-02-20 19:56:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

It seems that this change, by changing the common 'testenv' settings, would cause all tox-run jobs to go against neutron-lib master.  But what if I do not want to do so?  We also introduce the risk that a coding error in neutron-lib immediately breaks check and gate jobs for neutron, as opposed to only at n-l release time.

I think that it would be nice to have a tox target to run against neutron-lib master, but it shouldn't be the default behavior."}, {'account_id': 10980, 'date': '2019-02-20 20:12:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Actually, it only runs a local version of neutron-lib (with any change, doesn't have to be master), if the env var is defined.  Otherwise it is identical to today, and pulls from requirements. I'm halfway thinking it'd be nice to also add a way to pull from the depends-on label, but that could be later."}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-02-20 20:27:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

OK cool, definitely useful!'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-02-20 21:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/638012/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 35m 42s'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-02-21 04:41:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

You should also add something to TESTING.rst in the 'PEP8 and Unit Tests' section"}, {'account_id': 10980, 'date': '2019-02-28 05:04:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

-1 wf, pending changes for haleyb's feedback"}, {'account_id': 10980, 'date': '2019-03-02 21:56:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-03-02 23:31:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/638012/3 : SUCCESS in 1h 34m 28s'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-03-04 16:08:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-03-04 17:49:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Deploy templates: API & notifications

Adds deploy_templates REST API endpoints for retrieving, creating,
updating and deleting deployment templates. Also adds notification
objects for deploy templates.

Bumps the minimum WSME requirement to 0.9.3, since the lower constraints
job was failing with a 500 error when sending data in an unexpected
format to the POST /deploy_templates API.

Change-Id: I0e8c97e600f9b1080c8bdec790e5710e7a92d016
Story: 1722275
Task: 28677

commit_message:
Check health policy v1.0 before upgrade

Stein introduces health policy version 1.1 which is incompatible with
health policy version 1.0.  Users are required to delete version 1.0
health policies before upgrade and recreate them in version 1.1 format
after upgrading.

Change-Id: If319caed128b928a9d60fb0e8cee75bb601a09e3

commit_message:
Deploy templates: conductor

Adds the conductor-side logic required to map an instance's requested
traits to zero or more deploy templates. The steps defined in those
deploy templates are combined and added to deployment steps from the
driver interfaces, and used when provisioning the node.

The deploy steps for a node that come from deploy templates are
validated during node validation, and when deploying a node.

Change-Id: Ic4ac7926a1eaeb8b84d4f9f1af23bbe54554f250
Story: 1722275
Task: 28675

commit_message:
Ensure list_with_limit tests pass

Currently the list_with_limit tests are passing by luck due to concurrent tests
running, since they require 3 resources to be present in order for the 'next'
marker to be included in the response. Well done to Ruby Loo for spotting this
in the deploy templates tests.

Change-Id: I67f6737c6bc1bdef22dac5a24c577a3d450233a6

These projects aren't part of governance or requirements, I don't think something is required but please let me know if I am mistaken.

I sent a patch to remove the zuul.yaml files but we need to merge noop jobs from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/640818/ first.

commit_message:
Retire ara-{server,clients,plugins} repos: they've been merged to ara

These three repositories were folded back into a single feature/1.0
branch of the openstack/ara project.
The use case for keeping them separate doesn't justify the additional
management and maintenance overhead.

Change-Id: If75e3ad50eb3cebe315d5da855324d42ae0fd3c9

commit_message:
Add 2 new options to Pool for support backend certificates validation

This patch add 2 new options, which are '--ca-tls-container-ref' and
'--crl-container-ref' into Pool CLI.

'--ca-tls-container-ref' will store the ca certificate used by backend
servers.
'--crl-container-ref' will store the revocation list file.

Change-Id: I8da1c081549433fcc3d99a7675886d5167720125
Story: 2003858
Task: 26679
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614447/

commit_message:
Add 'tls_container_ref' option into Pool for backend re-encrption

This patch add 'tls_container_ref' option into Pool, support
create/update operation. This is a part of backend re-encryption
function. The other patches are following.

Change-Id: I3e3b8cbfe2546d71ef6bc6ccd9129a7787598989
Story: 2003859

commit_message:
Added tar option to preserve metadata of existing fetch_dir

Added tar option to allow the current user to unpack local
or downloaded data (from swift) into ceph-ansible/fetch_dir,
preserving the existing metadata.
Added also a "/*" as trailing character on the *path field* of
the *archive* ansible task to create a tar.gz containing all
the fetch_dir content whithout including the parent directory
in the resulting path: in this way we should be able to avoid
nested fetch_dir.

1. Added a step to fix broken environment excluding the nested
fetch_dir from the archive sections;

2. Added a new task to delete from filesystem the nested
section to make everything clean: this task is executed
according to the output of the previous one (the archive task).

Change-Id: I45c394bd6b5c09730399202b476ed913e8f334c0
Related-Bug: 1816094
(cherry picked from commit 548f54b39d1e5f895af16b93646e9e7925ffd488)

[{'created': '2018-10-15 14:02:43.000000000', 'message': "Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I3ac6546e79112820906ef02ce372c6c964921bec
